Reviews.Title: “What a special find in the heart of Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: Deneeta P
Reviews.Content: An Italian friend of mine booked this property for me and a girlfriend. I travel a lot and would typically stay at Starwood properties due to my status but I wanted to have a more "rustic" Italian experience on this trip. I am very type A so am even to this day surprised I allowed my friend to book me in a hotel in which I was unfamiliar but I went with it. I am so glad I did! We arrived to this CUTE hotel which was conveniently located just steps from the Spanish Steps. We were met by smiles and attention by the hotel clerk who made us comfortable while our room was prepared. The hotel is small but couldn't be more charming. Our room was tastefully updated in modern ameneties and again, while small, made the best use of the space. The beds were comfortable, the hotel was quiet and in the morning, we had a lovely breakfast in the dining room which was included in the room rate. I am so glad we discovered this gem and will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Location location location! (and friendly staff).”
Reviews.Author: Chowarahelp
Reviews.Content: The location of this little boutique hotel could not be bettered, everything is in walking distance from The Spanish Steps & The Trevi Fountain (2or3 mins), The Pantheon (10 mins), Colosseum (15 mins) right over to the Vatican (20-25mins). The rooms are very well appointed although perhaps a little small. The staff were very welcoming & accommodating. We wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel again on a return to Rome. (we threw coins in the fountain, so we're sure to return!)

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Excelent Location”
Reviews.Author: Guilherme R
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, well located between Piazza di Spagna and Fontana di Trevi.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Siena 28 November 2011 "Magnificently sited hotel with chic smart decor and nice staff. We enjoyed our stay at t”
Reviews.Author: curly47
Reviews.Content: Nice clean and smart hotel near Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps - sights everyone wants to see. Helpful efficient staff. Welcome drink very welcome at 11pm. Modern rooms; wooden floors and b/w decor. comfortable beds. Lift small but this is an old building! adequate for 2 plus luggage. Nice simple breakfast, and pleasant service. 'good eggs', says my daughter, pun intended no doubt. Hotel a bit difficult to find- directions peter out at the end. Locals professed not to know, had to use iPhone. we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Comfort in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: edyrp
Reviews.Content: Hotel Siena was a welcoming and comfortable place after our cruise. The location was its first appeal. It is walking distance to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, and the shops at Via Condotti. The hotel staff was helpful and most of them were friendly. As for the others, it's hard to be too friendly when the English is a struggle.They arranged our ride to the airport for the next day and helped us bring our (lots of) luggage up to our fourth floor room in several trips in their tiny elevator (normal for European boutique hotels from what I've seen). The room was clean and comfortable. It was small, which is also normal for European hotels, but we had all the space we needed. I liked the hardwood floor, which made the hotel room seem cleaner than most.The bed was comfortable. Keep in mind there is no A/C if you stay there in the summer. This was not an issue to us in early November, and there is a high-tech fan and a window one could open in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: ExecutiveChefFL
Reviews.Content: For a first time visitor to Rome, Hotel Siena was in the perfect location. Centrally located, staff was very on point, room was clean and nice. Awesome shower and decent size - nicely appointed. The complimentary breakfast was on point and the woman working in the break ate area- whose name I don't remember, was extremely pleasant and had a wonderful smile... And amadeus great cappuccinos. It was a delightful start to the day and left us well nourished in anticipation of a long day of Cobblestone hopping. Only downside, the walls were a bit on the thin side, and to be in a busy area, it could get a little loud. As someone who works in the hotel industry food the past 20 years, attention to detail is often in the forefront of my mind and this hotel passed my high standards. Even the professional pictures posted online are a perfect representation and I would have no trouble recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, art deco zebra kissed appeal”
Reviews.Author: flaresBrighton
Reviews.Content: I had the absolute pleasure of staying in this delightful chic little gem of a hotel for 12 nights! I arrived late in the evening and I was greeted warmly and welcomed with a cocktail from their bar. My room was modern with a black leather headboard, large bed, balcony, lovely slick black tiled en-suite bathroom. It contained good air-conditioning (needed in August), a mini-bar, reasonable storage space and a safe to put valuable items. The rooms are cleaned very well by the friendly staff daily. The guys at reception are warm, friendly and very helpful for any queries you may have. They will give you a handy map of Rome to show you were everything is located. In the mornings breakfast (7.30am-10am) is a self service buffet style affair, you can eat as much or as little as you want, in a clean inviting room with everything you need to get started on your adventures; cereal, cold meats, fruit, croissants, pastries, bread, juice and you will be served coffee to your liking by a very friendly woman who always has a smile! One of the main advantages of this hotel is just how centrally located you are to so much, Trevi fountain is a few minutes away, so is the spanish steps. Right beside the spanish steps is the Metro/train station 'Spagna" which you go through to a) use the metro system which is very convenient (i.e. only a few stops to the Vatican) and b) you can walk through the tunnel to get to the wonderful Borghese Galleria - it's all signposted and very easy! You can walk to the colosseum, the Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Piazza del Popolo, Museo dell 'Ara Pacis, Galleria Doria Pamphilj, Capitoline Museums and more... for those of you who like shopping you will be spoilt by the high end shops around the corner, i.e Prada, Versace, Chanel, Emporio Armani, Gucci etc However, there are more high street shops on 'Via del Corso' i.e. Gap, Adidas, Diesel, Zara, Levi etc. In the evenings you're again spoilt by the plethora of restaurants in which you can dine that are close to the hotel...as well as places to indulge in delicious gelato (ice cream)Finally, if you haven't been to Rome before, when you go out and you use the toilet, in some places when you're ready to wash your hands there are no taps! Look at the floor you will see a pedal, press down and hey presto water! Anyway, I really recommend this hotel - I would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Not on a bet”
Reviews.Author: jogger2
Reviews.Content: We booked five nights at this hotel and left after one night. Other than being clean, although the room had an awful odor from incense oil sticks, I can not say anything positive about our experience. The rooms were very small and when a cot was added to one room for our children, the double bed and cot consumed the entire floor space. The two floors on which our rooms were located were under construction and there was construction debris in the hall. The shower/bath tub had a "window" at one end which opened onto an internal fire escape; however the glass in the "window" was not frosted and there was construction scaffolding erected in the fire escape. The service was non existent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: asyathesaint
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with friend for a week. The location was just perfect: Trevi fontain and Spanish steps just 5 min walk and the area aroun hotel is nice. Breakfast was average but very good anyway, staff is very helpfull and nice, speaks english fluently. We had a very small room, but it was clean and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “location,location,location”
Reviews.Author: VanillkaLondon
Reviews.Content: Good base for exploring Rome,few minutes away from Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountains.Little rooms but that's common in Rome,clean,chic and relaxing,breakfast bit average.Friendly and helpful staff.Definitely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “great location, sexy room, Rome chic”
Reviews.Author: lolasophia
Reviews.Content: This beautifully updated, sexy little hotel couldn't have been in a better spot. We walked out our door into the thick of the most beautiful shopping, people and history in all of Europe. Great breakfast, wireless hotspot, enough said!

Reviews.Title: “cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrism1973
Reviews.Content: cute little hotel about a 2 minute walk from the trevi fountain. as long as you're willing to walk, everything is pretty much walking distance. we booked the hotel last minute goingoff other peoples reviews on trip advisor and we were'nt dissapointed at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: jtmoore20112
Reviews.Content: Siena is under-rated as a three-star hotel. A short walk from the Spanish Steps and the nearby Metro stop. We loved our room. Clean, well-appointed room and bath. Very quiet. Restaurants in the immediate area aren't plush, but we loved the food. The Forum and Coliseum are a short bus ride away, and we took the bus to go there but walked back to the hotel by way of the Trevi Fountain. We only had a couple of days in Rome after a cruise, but Siena's location helped us see many of the local sights while not skrimping on style.

Reviews.Title: “Rude service”
Reviews.Author: BinnaOslo
Reviews.Content: I went to the brekfast hall at the hotel my first morning in Rome. I didn`t know where I should get my tea. I looked around and saw a table with tea cups and tea and went there. A middelaged blond woman who worked there became angry and told me that I couldn`t wait for my tea. I didn`t know that she she should serve the tea. I was just looking around - and didn`t say anything! The next thing that happen is that a dark woman in her forties who was helping with the breakfast (othertimes she worked in the reseption) also started to shout . She kept saying "what is wrong?", was angry and followed me till my table. The other people who were eating brekfast were looking. I was completely in shoock about this rude behavior, I was just looking at them and didn`t say anything.

Reviews.Title: “Disastrous: don't bother with Siena”
Reviews.Author: slickoperator
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dreadful. I arrived having requested a quiet room at the back of the hotel, only to be given a room on the first floor at the front, facing the street. 'But don't worry', said the receptionist, 'because cars aren't allowed to use the road.' I told her immediately that I knew that was wrong because I had just driven in front of the hotel in a taxi. 'Ah, but only taxis are allowed to use the road', she replied. 'Oh really?' I said. 'Why, then, were there several cars driving behind my taxi, as well as a motorbike?' She couldn't answer that, but nor could she give me a decent room. Instead I got a dark, narrow, grubby room facing the window, which not only caught all the traffic noises from the street, but also was right underneath the buskers who often stopped immediately below me to sing to the diners below. The bathroom was horrible; it was a very small cupboard into which they'd tried unsuccessfully to fit a WC, washbasin and shower. It simply wasn't possible to use any of these things properly. I have stayed at a number of Rome hotels in my life and none of them were as horrible as this. More importantly, the attitude of the people working in them was not just unhelpful but rude. Go anywhere else but don't bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Rome in February”
Reviews.Author: Antsu71
Reviews.Content: Cosy little hotel in excellent location and very friendly staff. Small, clean rooms, our room was inward and absolutely quiet. Breakfast rather good for Italian standard. In walking distance to all the great sights.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkItalylover
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the Hotel Siena. We understood that the rooms would be small and dark (and they were). What we DIDN'T expect, however, was that it wasn't very clean. We could have stood the small, dark room (it is Rome), but the rooms were grubby and dusty. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at Siena Hotel for one week in the begining of May 2006, and it was quite pleasent. The room at the top floor had an anoying (for me, not for her) low ceilling and the window was tiny, but the place was clean and the bathroom Ok. The staff was very pleasent. Breafast was italian style with pre package stuff. The Hotel is superbely located at the heart of old Rome a small footwalk from the major tourist interesting places (Trevi fountain, Spanish Steps, Via Venetto, etc) and from the underground station ans bus stops.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location, especially for an introduction to Rome. Walking distance to all the major sites. Piazza di Spagna (Spanish Steps) are two minutes one way and Trevi Fountain is about five minutes the other. Villa Borghese is nearby, as is via Venuto and other trendy parts of Rome. Easy access, too, to the subway and Termini train station. Hotel is quaint and clean. Yes, some of the rooms are dark, so ask for rooms lower than fourth floor, which has the smallest windows. Breakfasts are good and geared to North American crowd with cereals (with cold milk), pastries and yogurts. They'll even serve North American-style coffee, but go for the Italian stuff. Much better.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: rocco00
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in mid-October and we not impressed at all. First, they told us they didn't have our reservation and because of that would have to put us in the top floor. This room had a very low ceiling, and only a 2 x 2 " window and was hot, stuffy and cramped to say the least. When we entered the room, it had not been cleaned since it's last occupant. Despite numerous requests to be moved to another room, they would not budge. I wanted to leave and find another hotel but stayed on at my husband's request.

Reviews.Title: “dark and smelly”
Reviews.Author: argentesi
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Siena over the holiday weekend 22-25 april. We booked well in advance and the hotel came very highly recommended. Arrived very late due to late arrival of Pendolino from Milan and were clearly given worst rooms in hotel. My daighter's single was ok but instead of a double bedded room we were given a minute, dark corridor-type room with two very small singles placed end to end. The room stank of cigar smoke - even the bed linen and bath towels. When we complained we were told we could look for another hotel if we wished - this was the weekend of the new pope's installation with half a million pilgrims camping out in Rome! Breakfast was another trial we had to queue for 20 minutes for a table. What was meant to be a very special weekend was almost ruined by this disappointing hotel with very unhelpful desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good overnight hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grovemontjanet
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, great location near the Spanish Steps and the Via Corso. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast. Rooms are small and basic.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved it! We just returned from a trip to Italy spending 4 nights in Rome and 4 in Florence. Hotel Siena was perfect. The staff went out of their way to help us! My Mother is 81 and I am disabled; they kept an eye out to ensure our safety and comfort----the result was that I never wanted to leave. The breakfast is terrific with pastries, cereals, fruits, assorted cheeses and as much coffee--any way you wish--as much as you wish! The hotel was so central that when we asked for directions to the Spanish Steps or the Trevi Fountain, the locals smiled politely and usually said--it is just around the corner.... When I return, which cannot be too soon, this is my pick!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, its location, is in the heart of Rome! next to the Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi (sighseeing) and Via Condotti and Via del Corso (shopping). The staff is really friendly, breakfast is good and their capuccino is better! The room is really clean, altough a little dark (we stayed at de 401). I will stay here again on our next visit to Rome. And Rome... Rome is awesome!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Siena
HotelInfo.Address: Via S Andrea Delle Fratte 33, 00187 Rome, Italy
